sen.j: 近藤悠三（こんどうゆうぞう 1902年2月8日-1985年2月25日）は日本の陶芸家。
sen.e: Yuzo KONDO (February 8, 1902 - February 25, 1985) was a Japanese potter.
Yuzo KONDO (February 8, 1902 - February 25, 1985) was a Japanese potter.
Yuzo KONDO (February 8, 1902 - February 25, 1985) was a Japanese potter.

sen.j: 1977年に人間国宝に認定。
sen.e: He was designated a Living National Treasure in 1977.
He was designated a Living National Treasure in 1977.
He was designated a Living National Treasure in 1977.

sen.j: 本名は近藤雄三。
sen.e: His real name was 近藤雄三 (read Yuzo KONDO with different kanji character)
His real name was 近藤雄三 (read Yuzo KONDO with different kanji character)
His real name was 近藤雄三 (read Yuzo KONDO with different kanji character).
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 京都市清水寺下出身。
sen.e: He was from Shimizuderashita, Kyoto City.
He was from Shimizuderashita, Kyoto City.
He was from Shimizuderashita, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 父正平、母千鶴の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born the third son of Shohei (father) and Chizuru (mother).
He was born the third son of Shohei (father) and Chizuru (mother).
He was born the third son of Shohei (father) and Chizuru (mother).

sen.j: 祖父である正慎は清水寺の寺侍であった。
sen.e: His grandfather, Shoshin, was samurai serving Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
His grandfather, Shoshin, was samurai serving Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
His grandfather, Shoshin, was samurai serving Kiyomizu-dera Temple.

sen.j: 1914年、京都市立陶磁器試験場付属伝習所轆轤科に入所。
sen.e: In 1914, he entered Kyoto Ceramic Experimental Station Attached Training Center.
sen.cmt: 京都市立陶磁器試験場付属伝習所轆轤科⇒定訳不明
sen.e: In 1914, he entered Kyoto Ceramic Experimental Station Attached Training Center.
In 1914, he entered Kyoto Ceramic Experimental Station Attached Training Center.

sen.j: 1917年に卒業後、同試験場で助手として勤務する。
sen.e: After graduating in 1917, he was hired as an assistant at the station.
After graduating in 1917, he was hired as an assistant at the station.
After graduating in 1917, he was hired as an assistant at the station.

sen.j: 当時、河井寛次郎と濱田庄司が東京高等工業を卒業して技手として陶磁を研究しており、近藤は濱田から窯業科学などを学んだ。
sen.e: At the time, Kanjiro KAWAI and Shoji HAMADA graduated from Tokyo Higher Technical School and were researching ceramics, and Kondo learned ceramics engineering from Hamada.
At the time, Kanjiro KAWAI and Shoji HAMADA graduated from Tokyo Higher Technical School and were researching ceramics, and Kondo learned ceramics engineering from Hamada.
At the time, Kanjiro KAWAI and Shoji HAMADA graduated from Tokyo Higher Technical School and were researching ceramics, and Kondo learned ceramics engineering from Hamada.

sen.j: 1921年に陶磁器試験場を辞め、イギリスから帰国して大和に窯を構えた富本憲吉の助手として師事。
sen.e: In 1921, he quit the experimental station and became an assistant to Kenkichi TOMIMOTO, who had just returned from England and opened a kiln in Yamato.
In 1921, he quit the experimental station and became an assistant to Kenkichi TOMIMOTO, who had just returned from England and opened a kiln in Yamato.
In 1921, he quit the experimental station and became an assistant to Kenkichi TOMIMOTO, who had just returned from England and opened a kiln in Yamato.

sen.j: 素地や釉薬などの技法だけでなく、制作に対する心構えについても指導を受けている。
sen.e: He learned about groundwork and glaze technology as well as spirit of ceramics art from Tomimoto
He learned about groundwork and glaze technology as well as the spirit of ceramics art from Tomimoto
He learned about groundwork and glaze technology as well as the spirit of ceramics art from Tomimoto.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 1924年京都に戻った後、関西美術院洋画研究所でデッサンや洋画の研究をする傍ら、清水新道石段下に窯を構え制作を始める。
sen.e: After returning to Kyoto in 1924, he studied sketches and western style painting at Kansai Art Academy and Western Art Research Institute, and established a kiln at Kiyomizu Shindo Ishidanshita.
After returning to Kyoto in 1924, he studied sketches and western style painting at Kansai Art Academy and Western Art Research Institute, and established a kiln at Kiyomizu Shindo Ishidanshita.
After returning to Kyoto in 1924, he studied sketches and western style painting at Kansai Art Academy and Western Art Research Institute, and established a kiln at Kiyomizu Shindo Ishidanshita.

sen.j: この頃は染付の他に、釉裏紅や象嵌等の技法も用いた作品を発表していた。
sen.e: He was also presenting works of art of under glazed cobalt blue technique as well works using yuurikou and inlay techniques.
He was also presenting works of art of under glazed cobalt blue technique as well works using yuurikou and inlay techniques.
He was also presenting works of art of under glazed cobalt blue technique as well works using yuurikou and inlay techniques.

sen.j: 1926年、24歳で中島光子と結婚。
sen.e: In 1926, he married Mitsuko NAKAJIMA at the age of 24.
In 1926, he married Mitsuko NAKAJIMA at the age of 24.
In 1926, he married Mitsuko NAKAJIMA at the age of 24.

sen.j: 1928年の第9回帝展で初入選を果たし、以後13回連続で入選する。
sen.e: In 1928, he won a prize at the 9th Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten) for the first time, thereafter winning 13 consecutive times.
In 1928, he won a prize at the 9th Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten) for the first time, thereafter winning 13 consecutive times.
In 1928, he won a prize at the 9th Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten) for the first time, thereafter winning 13 consecutive times.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 他、文展などで多くの作品を発表。
sen.e: He also presented many works at Bunten and other exhibitions.
He also presented many works at Bunten and other exhibitions.
He also presented many works at Bunten and other exhibitions.

sen.j: 1950年には第6回日展で審査員を務めた。
sen.e: In 1950, he served as a judge at the 6th Nitten Exhibition.
In 1950, he served as a judge at the 6th Nitten Exhibition.
In 1950, he served as a judge at the 6th Nitten Exhibition.

sen.j: 1955年に日本工芸会に帰属。
sen.e: In 1955, he rejoined Nihon Kogeikai (the Japan Art Crafts Association).
In 1955, he rejoined Nihon Kogeikai (the Japan Art Crafts Association).
In 1955, he rejoined Nihon Kogeikai (the Japan Art Crafts Association).

sen.j: 1956年、「山水染付壺」で第3回日本伝統工芸展が日本伝統工芸会賞を受賞。
sen.e: In 1956, he received the gold award for Japanese Traditional Crafts at the 3rd Japan Traditional Art Crafts Exhibition with his "Sansui Dyed Pot"
In 1956, he received the gold award for Japanese Traditional Crafts at the 3rd Japan Traditional Art Crafts Exhibition with his "Sansui Dyed Pot"
In 1956, he received the gold award for Japanese Traditional Crafts at the 3rd Japan Traditional Art Crafts Exhibition with his 'Sansui Dyed Pot.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 1956年には岐阜県多治見市にて志野焼の研究をしている。
sen.e: He studied Shino ware in Tajimi City, Gifu Prefecture in 1956.
He studied Shino ware in Tajimi City, Gifu Prefecture in 1956.
He studied Shino ware in Tajimi City, Gifu Prefecture in 1956.

sen.j: 以降は染付の制作に専念した。
sen.e: Thereafter, he concentrated on the creation of under glazed cobalt blue works.
Thereafter, he concentrated on the creation of works using glazed cobalt blue.
Thereafter, he concentrated on the creation of works using glazed cobalt blue.

sen.j: つけたてとぼかしを基調とした筆遣いによって濃淡を表し、ザクロや梅などをモチーフとして絵画的な表現を為した。
sen.e: He expressed the dark and light with the brush technique based on tsuketate and gradation, presenting paintings like the motifs of pomegranates and plums.
He expressed the dark and light with the brush technique based on tsuketate and gradation, presenting paintings like the motifs of pomegranates and plums.
He expressed the dark and light with the brush technique based on tsuketate and gradation, presenting paintings like the motifs of pomegranates and plums.

sen.j: 更に1960年以降、呉須染付に併用して赤絵や金彩の技法を用いる様になり、更に独特の作風を確立した。
sen.e: After 1960, he started using techniques to add red and gold on Gosu sometsuke, establishing his own style.
After 1960, he started using techniques to add red and gold on Gosu sometsuke, establishing his own style.
After 1960, he started using techniques to add red and gold on Gosu sometsuke, establishing his own style.

sen.j: 日本工芸会常任理事、陶芸部会長を歴任。
sen.e: He served as the executive director of the Nihon Kogeikai and chairman of the Ceramics Division.
He served as the executive director of the Nihon Kogeikai and chairman of the Ceramics Division.
He served as the executive director of the Nihon Kogeikai and chairman of the Ceramics Division.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 1953年京都市立美術大学陶磁器科助教授、1956年同大学教授、1965年10月には学長に就任した。
sen.e: He taught as the assistant professor and professor in the Ceramics Arts Department, Kyoto City University of Fine Arts and held the office of chancellor in October 1965.
He taught as the assistant professor and professor in the Ceramics Arts Department, Kyoto City University of Fine Arts and held the office of chancellor in October 1965.

He taught as the assistant professor and professor in the Ceramics Arts Department, Kyoto City University of Fine Arts from 1953, became the professor in 1956, and held the office of chancellor in October 1965.
sen.cmt: from 1953, became the professor in 1956, 補足しました。

sen.j: 1970年に紫綬褒章、1973年には勲等瑞宝章、京都市文化功労者章を受章。
sen.e: He received the Shiju Hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon) in 1970, the Zui Hosho (Orders of the Sacred Treasure) and the Kyoto City Cultural Order Award in 1973.
He received the Shiju Hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon) in 1970, the Zui Hosho (Orders of the Sacred Treasure) and the Kyoto City Cultural Order Award in 1973.
He received the Shiju Hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon) in 1970, the Zui Hosho (Orders of the Sacred Treasure) and the Kyoto City Cultural Order Award in 1973.

sen.j: 1977年4月25日、重要無形文化財（人間国宝）「染付」の保持者に認定された。
sen.e: On April 25, 1977, he was designated as an important intangible cultural heritage (Living National Treasure) as the holder of sometsuke skills.
On April 25, 1977, he was designated as an important intangible cultural heritage (Living National Treasure) as the holder of sometsuke skills.
On April 25, 1977, he was designated as an important intangible cultural heritage (Living National Treasure) as the holder of 'sometsuke' skills.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて'補足しました。

sen.j: 1980年、褒章受章。
sen.e: He was awarded the Medal of Honor in 1980.
He was awarded the Medal of Honor in 1980.
He was awarded the Medal of Honor in 1980.
He died in 1985.
He died in 1985.
He died in 1985.
